title: Sam Burgess parties in Sydney as estranged wife Phoebe flees the city
text:
Sam Burgess looked far from heartbroken while partying in Sydney on Friday night - just two days before it was revealed he's believed to have split from wife Phoebe for a second time.

The South Sydney Rabbitohs star, 30, was filmed having fun with friends on the dancefloor at the club's 2019 Red & Green Ball at the ICC Grand Ballroom in Darling Harbour.

In the footage, Sam, who was not wearing his wedding ring, appeared in high spirits while celebrating at the masquerade-themed event which marks the end of the rugby league season for the club.

Night out: Sam Burgess looked far from heartbroken while partying in Sydney over the weekend, two days before news broke of his 'split' from wife Phoebe

At one point, a smiling Sam gives the thumbs up to the camera.

On Sunday, Sam's brother George Burgess shared another video of the sportsman at a bar alongside retiring teammate, John Sutton, who is the most capped player in the Rabbitoh's history.

In the footage, George asked his Instagram followers to vote whom they would rather 'kiss'.

As John pushed his tongue out towards the camera, Sam said: 'Together... us together.'

Party: The South Sydney Rabbitohs star, 30, was filmed having fun with friends on the dancefloor at the club's 2019 Red & Green Ball at the ICC Grand Ballroom on Friday

Telling: Sam was not wearing his wedding ring but nonetheless appeared in high spirits while celebrating at the masquerade-themed event. Pictured: Sam with other party guests

Meanwhile, Phoebe spent the weekend at her parents' country estate in Bowral with her children: two-year-old daughter Poppy and 10-month-old son Billy.

Tellingly, the couple have unfollowed each other on Instagram.

Over the weekend, The Sunday Telegraph reported that Sam and Phoebe, 30, had broken up for a second time after initially splitting in December.

The pair had rekindled their marriage in April, but an insider claimed things 'just didn't work.'

Partying: On Sunday, Sam's brother George Burgess shared another video of the sportsman at a bar alongside their teammate John Sutton (right)

Vote: In the video, George asked his Instagram followers to vote whom they would rather 'kiss'

Apart: Meanwhile, Phoebe spent the weekend at her parents' country estate in Bowral with her children: two-year-old daughter Poppy and 10-month-old son Billy (pictured in August)

The source added: 'The most important thing for them is that their children are happy and healthy, that is their priority.'

According to the publication, Sam 'moved out of their $3.8million family home in Maroubra in late September.'

Neither Sam nor Phoebe has publicly commented on their rumoured split.

Over the weekend, the former journalist shared several photos to Instagram from her parents' home in Bowral, in the NSW Southern Highlands.

Sam and Phoebe Burgess: A timeline of their love January 2014: Sam and Phoebe meet at an Avicii concert in Sydney

October 2014: Phoebe relocates to UK with Sam after he signs with Bath Ruby

June 2015: Sam proposes during a romantic holiday in Greece

December 2015: They marry at Phoebe's parents' home in the NSW Southern Highlands after returning to Australia

January 2017: Phoebe gives birth to their first child, daughter Poppy

December 2018: They welcome second child, son Billy

December 2018: The couple split as Sam is cleared of any wrongdoing amid a 'sexting' scandal involving his South Sydney Rabbitohs teammates

April 2019: The couple announce they are back together

October 2019: They reportedly split for a second time

The end? Over the weekend, The Sunday Telegraph reported that Sam and Phoebe, 30, had broken up for a second time after initially splitting in December last year

Done and dusted? Tellingly, the couple have unfollowed each other on Instagram

In April, Phoebe confirmed to Stellar magazine that she and Sam had reconciled after their initial split in December, but admitted things weren't 'perfect'.

'Every person on this planet who is married knows it isn't perfect. It's never going to be perfect... Sam and I will have good days and we'll have trying days,' she said.

Phoebe added that the reason for their split, and the details of their reconciliation, 'will always and forever just be between Sam and I'.
